title: The Score: Six Flags, Apple, WeWork and More Stocks That Defined the Week
text: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week's news.

title: Q3 Results Reflect Positivity, But Outlook Uncertain
text: Estimates for 2023 Q4 and following quarters have started to come down, which follows a relatively stable revisions trend over the preceding six months.

title: Apple Shares Fall Amid Concerns About China Sales But Analysts Say They're Overblown
text: Apple (AAPL) shares fell 0.5% Friday after the tech giant reported declining revenue for the fourth straight quarter, in part due to lower sales in China from the same period a year ago. However, some analysts say worries surrounding sales in China, a key market for Apple, may be overblown.

title: Apple employee fired over antisemitic Instagram message: ‘You sneak into countries'
text: Natasha Dach has been removed from Apple's employee directory after her social media post was unearthed by "StopAntisemitism."

title: Apple Needs a New Growth Strategy. The Stock Is Counting On It.
text: Apple's latest forecast was disappointing, but there's a bigger concern for investors. The company still hasn't spent any time talking about generative AI.

title: Apple's (AAPL) Q4 Earnings Beat Estimates, Revenues Fall Y/Y
text: Apple's (AAPL) fourth-quarter fiscal 2023 results suffer from forex headwind and challenging macro environment conditions despite Services growth.

title: Apple Stock Falls 3% After Forecast for Weak Holiday Quarter
text: Apple shares reportedly experienced a decline after the company issued a warning Thursday (Nov. 2) about a lackluster holiday quarter. The stock initially fell more than 3% before trading opened, but later pared losses to 1.5% after a U.S. jobs report suggested a potential pause in interest rate hikes by the Federal Reserve, Reuters reported Friday (Nov. 3).

title: The 3 Best Tech Stocks to Buy in November
text: The recent decision by the Federal Reserve to maintain steady interest rates highlights a complex situation that policymakers are grappling with. Despite the robust performance of the U.S. economy, there is uncertainty at the central bank regarding the tightness of financial conditions necessary to rein in inflation, which still exceeds its 2% target.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook says AI is a fundamental technology, confirms investments in generative AI
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook pushed back a bit at the notion that the company was behind in AI on yesterday's Q4 earnings call with investors, as he highlighted technology developments that Apple had made recently that “would not be possible without AI.

title: Apple's Resilient 6% Rebound - Overcoming A 16% Dip And Eyeing New Heights Following Positive Earnings Results
text: Despite a broader decline in hardware sales, Apple Inc AAPL has defied the trend with its flagship product, the iPhone.

title: Apple Stock Slips Amid Slew of Post-Earnings Bear Notes
text: Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL ) stock was last seen down 1.1% at $175.63.

title: Apple Q4 Earnings Beat, Outlook Upsets: ETFs in Focus
text: Apple iPhone sales hit a new record in the fiscal fourth quarter. However, it is overshadowed by a cautious outlook for the holiday quarter.

title: Nasdaq-100 futures slips then pumps after disappointing Apple's Q4 earnings
text: Nasdaq-100 futures slipped by 0.2% in response to Apple's fiscal fourth-quarter earnings report, indicating a challenging outlook for the technology sector. However, the Nasdaq-100 futures price has since gained +51.00 to trade at $15,049.00 at press time indicating some resilience amidst the challenging times.

title: 7 Evergreen Stocks for Long-term Wealth Generation
text: This column focuses on stocks to buy for long-term wealth creation with evergreen ideas. A key factor that separates evergreen businesses from others is necessity versus luxury.

title: Apple shows its ‘massive battleship' is getting tougher to move
text: Apple Inc.'s $89.5 billion in quarterly revenue is nothing to sneeze at, but it also illustrates some of the challenges of being a mature company.

title: Epic Games is the latest to take on Google in court over antitrust charges
text: The maker of the popular videogame “Fortnite,” which battled Apple Inc. AAPL, +2.07% in federal court on similar grounds in 2021, is set to open arguments in a jury trial expected to last several weeks starting Nov. 6 in San Francisco. It claims Alphabet Inc.'s GOOGL, +0.82% GOOG, +0.79% Google Play Store restricts competitors from directly distributing their own apps, and instead forces them to have their apps installed via the Play Store.

title: Investors Aren't Buying Apple's New iPhone
text: A subdued outlook indicates that investors' fears over the iPhone cycle and China aren't misplaced.

title: Apple stock drops on poor China sales as Block shares surge after fintech sets out 2024 forecast
text: Shares of Block Inc. SQ, +7.37% soared 18% after the Jack Dorsey-backed parent of fintech company Square set its sights on 2024 adjusted EBITDA of $2.4 billion, far outpacing analyst expectations around $1.94 billion.

title: Apple's sales fall for the fourth straight quarter despite a strong start for latest iPhones
text: Apple's sales remained on a downward slope during the summer, resulting in a full year of declining revenue at the technology trendsetter with a long history of steady growth that turned it into the world's most valuable publicly traded company.

title: China's Taken a Bite Out of Apple. There's No Quick Fix.
text: Concerns about the country's slow economic recovery and increasing competition are weighing on the tech giant's stock.

title: Apple's long-term growth story still intact, says tech-focused investment bank
text: In the wake of Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL)'s third-quarter numbers, a consensus seems to be emerging: look past the ephemeral concerns and consider the enduring strengths of the tech behemoth. Despite a revenue dip in its latest quarter, Apple's foundational sectors, such as iPhone sales and services, are showing promise of sustainable growth.

title: S&P 500 futures pause after soft Apple guidance as payrolls data awaits
text: U.S. stock futures were steady Friday ahead of key payrolls data and after soft guidance from tech heavyweight Apple.
